name: National Museum, New Delhi
description: India's largest museum showcasing over 200,000 works of art covering more than 5,000 years of Indian cultural heritage.

topExhibits.name: Dancing Girl of Mohenjo-daro
topExhibits.description: A 4,500-year-old bronze statuette from the Indus Valley Civilization, one of the most iconic artifacts of ancient India.
topExhibits.significance: Represents the artistic sophistication of the Harappan civilization

topExhibits.name: Buddha's Relics
topExhibits.description: Sacred relics of Lord Buddha, including bone fragments and ashes, housed in a golden casket.
topExhibits.significance: One of the most important Buddhist relics in the world

topExhibits.name: Chola Bronze Nataraja
topExhibits.description: A magnificent bronze sculpture of Lord Shiva in his cosmic dance form, created during the Chola dynasty.
topExhibits.significance: Exemplifies the pinnacle of Chola bronze artistry

topExhibits.name: Mughal Miniature Paintings
topExhibits.description: Exquisite collection of Mughal miniature paintings depicting court life, battles, and nature scenes.
topExhibits.significance: Showcases the fusion of Persian and Indian artistic traditions

topExhibits.name: Gandhi Memorabilia
topExhibits.description: Personal belongings of Mahatma Gandhi including his spectacles, spinning wheel, and letters.
topExhibits.significance: Symbols of India's freedom struggle and non-violence movement

name: Indian Museum, Kolkata
description: The oldest and largest multipurpose museum in India, established in 1814, housing rare collections of antiques, armor, and ornaments.

topExhibits.name: Asiatic Lion Skeleton
topExhibits.description: Complete skeleton of an Asiatic lion, showcasing the natural history collection.

topExhibits.name: Buddhist Relics from Piprahwa
topExhibits.description: Ancient Buddhist relics discovered in Piprahwa, believed to contain remains of Buddha's disciples.
topExhibits.significance: Rare archaeological find from the Mauryan period

topExhibits.name: Egyptian Mummy
topExhibits.description: A well-preserved Egyptian mummy, one of the few in India, showcasing ancient Egyptian burial practices.
topExhibits.significance: Rare example of Egyptian mummification outside Egypt

topExhibits.name: Gandhara Art Collection
topExhibits.description: Extensive collection of Gandhara sculptures showing Greco-Buddhist art style.
topExhibits.significance: Demonstrates the fusion of Greek and Indian artistic traditions

topExhibits.name: Rare Coins Collection
topExhibits.description: One of the largest numismatic collections in India, featuring coins from various dynasties.
topExhibits.significance: Chronicles India's economic history through currency

name: Salar Jung Museum, Hyderabad
description: One of the three National Museums of India, housing the art collection of the Salar Jung family.

topExhibits.name: Veiled Rebecca
topExhibits.description: A stunning marble sculpture by Italian artist Giovanni Maria Benzoni, famous for its translucent veil effect.

topExhibits.name: Double Statue of Mephistopheles and Margaretta
topExhibits.description: A unique wooden statue that shows two different characters when viewed from opposite sides.

topExhibits.name: Jade Dagger of Emperor Jahangir
topExhibits.description: Exquisitely crafted jade dagger belonging to Mughal Emperor Jahangir, inlaid with precious stones.

topExhibits.name: Quran Collection
topExhibits.description: Rare collection of handwritten Qurans from different periods, including one written in gold.
topExhibits.significance: Showcases Islamic calligraphy and manuscript art

topExhibits.name: European Paintings
topExhibits.description: Collection of European paintings including works by renowned artists like Raphael and Rembrandt.
topExhibits.significance: Rare European art collection in India

name: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Vastu Sangrahalaya, Mumbai
description: Formerly known as the Prince of Wales Museum, this Indo-Saracenic architecture building houses art, archaeology, and natural history collections.

topExhibits.name: Nataraja Bronze
topExhibits.description: A magnificent Chola bronze sculpture of Lord Shiva in his cosmic dance pose.

topExhibits.name: Gandhara Buddha Head
topExhibits.description: A beautifully carved Buddha head from the Gandhara region, showing Greco-Buddhist influence.
topExhibits.significance: Exemplifies the fusion of Greek and Buddhist art

topExhibits.name: Mughal Miniature Paintings
topExhibits.description: Collection of exquisite Mughal miniature paintings from the royal courts.
topExhibits.significance: Represents the golden age of Mughal painting

topExhibits.name: Nepalese Wood Carvings
topExhibits.description: Intricate wood carvings from Nepal showcasing Hindu and Buddhist iconography.

topExhibits.name: European Paintings
topExhibits.description: Collection of European oil paintings including landscapes and portraits.
topExhibits.significance: Shows European artistic influence in colonial India

name: Government Museum, Chennai
description: One of the oldest museums in India, established in 1851, known for its archaeological and numismatic collections.

topExhibits.name: Chola Bronze Collection
topExhibits.description: World's largest collection of Chola bronze sculptures, including various forms of Shiva and Vishnu.
topExhibits.significance: Pinnacle of South Indian bronze artistry

topExhibits.name: Amaravati Marbles
topExhibits.description: Buddhist sculptures and reliefs from the ancient Amaravati stupa, showcasing early Buddhist art.
topExhibits.significance: Important examples of early Buddhist art in South India

topExhibits.name: Pallava Stone Sculptures
topExhibits.description: Exquisite stone sculptures from the Pallava dynasty, known for their intricate carvings.
topExhibits.significance: Represents Pallava architectural and sculptural excellence

topExhibits.name: Rare Coins
topExhibits.description: Extensive collection of coins from various South Indian dynasties including Cholas, Pandyas, and Cheras.

topExhibits.name: Prehistoric Artifacts
topExhibits.description: Collection of stone tools and artifacts from prehistoric times found in Tamil Nadu.
topExhibits.significance: Evidence of early human habitation in South India

name: Calico Museum of Textiles, Ahmedabad
description: One of the finest textile museums in the world, showcasing India's rich textile heritage from the 15th century onwards.
openingHours: 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM, 2:30 PM - 4:30 PM (By appointment only)

topExhibits.name: Mughal Court Carpets
topExhibits.description: Exquisite handwoven carpets from the Mughal era, featuring intricate Persian designs.
topExhibits.significance: Represents the height of Mughal textile art

topExhibits.name: Patola Sarees
topExhibits.description: Rare double-ikat Patola sarees from Patan, known for their complex geometric patterns.

topExhibits.name: Pichhwai Paintings on Cloth
topExhibits.description: Devotional paintings on cloth depicting Lord Krishna, used as temple hangings.
topExhibits.significance: Unique form of textile art from Rajasthan

topExhibits.name: Kashmiri Shawls
topExhibits.description: Exquisite handwoven Pashmina and Kani shawls from Kashmir with intricate embroidery.

topExhibits.name: South Indian Temple Hangings
topExhibits.description: Colorful temple hangings and canopies from South Indian temples, showcasing regional textile traditions.
topExhibits.significance: Religious textiles from South Indian temple traditions

name: Victoria Memorial Hall, Kolkata
description: A magnificent marble building dedicated to Queen Victoria, housing a museum with British colonial artifacts and Indian art.

topExhibits.name: Queen Victoria's Statue
topExhibits.description: A grand marble statue of Queen Victoria, the centerpiece of the memorial.
topExhibits.significance: Symbol of British colonial rule in India

topExhibits.name: Paintings by European Artists
topExhibits.description: Collection of oil paintings depicting colonial India by British and European artists.

topExhibits.name: Bengal School Paintings
topExhibits.description: Paintings by artists of the Bengal School including Abanindranath Tagore and Nandalal Bose.

topExhibits.name: Royal Gallery
topExhibits.description: Portraits and memorabilia of British royalty and Indian princes from the colonial era.
topExhibits.significance: Historical documentation of the colonial period

topExhibits.name: Calcutta Gallery
topExhibits.description: Exhibition showcasing the history and development of Kolkata from a small village to a major city.
topExhibits.significance: Chronicles the urban history of Kolkata

name: Rajasthan State Museum, Jaipur
description: Houses a rich collection of artifacts, paintings, and sculptures representing Rajasthan's cultural heritage.

topExhibits.name: Rajasthani Miniature Paintings
topExhibits.description: Exquisite collection of Rajasthani miniature paintings from various schools including Mewar, Marwar, and Bundi.
topExhibits.significance: Represents the distinct style of Rajasthani painting

topExhibits.name: Arms and Armor
topExhibits.description: Collection of royal weapons, armor, and shields from Rajput kingdoms.

topExhibits.name: Stone Sculptures
topExhibits.description: Hindu and Jain stone sculptures from various periods of Rajasthan's history.

topExhibits.name: Coins and Medals
topExhibits.description: Numismatic collection featuring coins from various Rajput kingdoms and princely states.

topExhibits.name: Textiles and Costumes
topExhibits.description: Traditional Rajasthani textiles, costumes, and jewelry showcasing regional craftsmanship.

name: Kerala Museum, Kochi
description: Showcases Kerala's rich cultural heritage including traditional art, artifacts, and historical documents.

topExhibits.name: Kerala Mural Paintings
topExhibits.description: Traditional mural paintings from Kerala temples, depicting Hindu mythology and legends.
topExhibits.significance: Unique style of South Indian temple art

topExhibits.name: Cochin Port History
topExhibits.description: Exhibition documenting the history of Kochi as a major trading port and its interactions with various cultures.

topExhibits.name: Traditional Kerala Architecture Models
topExhibits.description: Scale models of traditional Kerala architecture including Nalukettu houses and temple structures.

topExhibits.name: Theyyam Masks and Costumes
topExhibits.description: Traditional Theyyam ritual masks, costumes, and accessories from North Kerala.
topExhibits.significance: Cultural and religious traditions of Kerala

topExhibits.name: Spice Trade Artifacts
topExhibits.description: Historical artifacts related to Kerala's spice trade including ancient maps, trade documents, and spice samples.
topExhibits.significance: Kerala's role in global spice trade

name: Birla Industrial & Technological Museum, Kolkata
description: India's first science museum, established in 1959, featuring interactive exhibits on science and technology.

topExhibits.name: Steam Engine Model
topExhibits.description: Working model of a steam engine demonstrating the Industrial Revolution technology.

topExhibits.name: Electricity Gallery
topExhibits.description: Interactive exhibits explaining electricity, magnetism, and electrical engineering principles.

topExhibits.name: Mining Gallery
topExhibits.description: Exhibition on mining technology and processes, including models of mining equipment.

topExhibits.name: Transport Gallery
topExhibits.description: Models and exhibits showcasing the evolution of transportation from bullock carts to modern vehicles.

topExhibits.name: Mathematics Gallery
topExhibits.description: Interactive mathematical models and puzzles demonstrating mathematical principles.

name: Archaeological Museum, Hampi
description: Houses artifacts and sculptures from the Vijayanagara Empire, one of the greatest empires in Indian history.

topExhibits.name: Vijayanagara Sculptures
topExhibits.description: Stone sculptures from the Vijayanagara period depicting Hindu deities and mythological scenes.
topExhibits.significance: Art from the golden age of Vijayanagara

topExhibits.name: Temple Architecture Models
topExhibits.description: Scale models of Vijayanagara temples showcasing the architectural grandeur of the empire.

topExhibits.name: Coins of Vijayanagara
topExhibits.description: Gold and copper coins minted during the Vijayanagara Empire, featuring various rulers.

topExhibits.name: Inscriptions
topExhibits.description: Stone inscriptions in various languages documenting the history and administration of Vijayanagara.

topExhibits.name: Weapons and Armor
topExhibits.description: Collection of weapons, armor, and military equipment from the Vijayanagara period.

name: Punjab State Museum, Chandigarh
description: Showcases the rich cultural heritage of Punjab including art, archaeology, and historical artifacts.

topExhibits.name: Harappan Artifacts
topExhibits.description: Artifacts from the Indus Valley Civilization sites in Punjab, including pottery and seals.
topExhibits.significance: Evidence of ancient civilization in Punjab

topExhibits.name: Sikh Art and Artifacts
topExhibits.description: Collection of Sikh religious art, manuscripts, and artifacts from the Sikh period.

topExhibits.name: Gandharan Sculptures
topExhibits.description: Buddhist sculptures from the Gandhara region, showing Greco-Buddhist artistic style.

topExhibits.name: Punjabi Folk Art
topExhibits.description: Traditional Punjabi folk art including Phulkari embroidery, paintings, and handicrafts.

topExhibits.name: Coins Collection
topExhibits.description: Numismatic collection featuring coins from various periods of Punjab's history.

name: Assam State Museum, Guwahati
description: Houses collections related to Assam's history, culture, and archaeology including Ahom period artifacts.

topExhibits.name: Ahom Royal Artifacts
topExhibits.description: Artifacts from the Ahom kingdom including royal regalia, weapons, and ceremonial objects.

topExhibits.name: Assamese Textiles
topExhibits.description: Traditional Assamese textiles including Muga silk, Eri silk, and traditional costumes.

topExhibits.name: Stone Sculptures
topExhibits.description: Hindu and Buddhist stone sculptures from various periods of Assam's history.

topExhibits.name: Manuscripts
topExhibits.description: Ancient manuscripts in Assamese, Sanskrit, and other languages on various subjects.

topExhibits.name: Tribal Artifacts
topExhibits.description: Artifacts and handicrafts from various tribal communities of Assam.

name: Goa State Museum, Panaji
description: Showcases Goa's rich history including Portuguese colonial artifacts, Hindu sculptures, and Christian art.

topExhibits.name: Portuguese Colonial Artifacts
topExhibits.description: Artifacts from the Portuguese colonial period including furniture, ceramics, and documents.

topExhibits.name: Hindu Sculptures
topExhibits.description: Stone sculptures of Hindu deities from pre-Portuguese Goa, showcasing ancient Goan art.

topExhibits.name: Christian Art
topExhibits.description: Christian religious art including paintings, sculptures, and artifacts from Goan churches.

topExhibits.name: Numismatic Collection
topExhibits.description: Coins from various periods including Portuguese, Maratha, and British colonial coins.

topExhibits.name: Printing Press History
topExhibits.description: Exhibition on the history of printing in Goa, including early printed books and printing equipment.
topExhibits.significance: Goa's role in the history of printing in India

name: Bharat Bhavan, Bhopal
description: A multi-arts complex and museum showcasing contemporary Indian art, tribal art, and performing arts.

topExhibits.name: Contemporary Indian Art
topExhibits.description: Collection of contemporary paintings, sculptures, and installations by modern Indian artists.

topExhibits.name: Tribal Art Collection
topExhibits.description: Extensive collection of tribal art from Madhya Pradesh including paintings, sculptures, and artifacts.
topExhibits.significance: Tribal cultural heritage of Central India

topExhibits.name: Gond Paintings
topExhibits.description: Traditional Gond tribal paintings known for their intricate patterns and vibrant colors.
topExhibits.significance: Indigenous art form from Central India

topExhibits.name: Sculpture Garden
topExhibits.description: Outdoor exhibition of contemporary sculptures by renowned Indian artists.

topExhibits.name: Photography Collection
topExhibits.description: Collection of photographs documenting Indian culture, society, and contemporary life.

name: Jawahar Kala Kendra, Jaipur
description: A multi-arts center designed by Charles Correa, showcasing Rajasthani culture, art, and performing arts.

topExhibits.name: Rajasthani Folk Art
topExhibits.description: Collection of Rajasthani folk paintings, including Phad, Pichwai, and miniature paintings.

topExhibits.name: Traditional Rajasthani Costumes
topExhibits.description: Exhibition of traditional Rajasthani costumes, jewelry, and textiles from different regions.

topExhibits.name: Musical Instruments
topExhibits.description: Collection of traditional Rajasthani musical instruments including string, wind, and percussion instruments.

topExhibits.name: Contemporary Art Gallery
topExhibits.description: Rotating exhibitions of contemporary art by Rajasthani and Indian artists.

topExhibits.name: Architecture Exhibition
topExhibits.description: Exhibition on the architecture of Jawahar Kala Kendra and Charles Correa's design philosophy.

name: Sarnath Museum, Varanasi
description: Houses artifacts from the ancient Buddhist site of Sarnath, where Buddha gave his first sermon.

topExhibits.name: Lion Capital of Ashoka
topExhibits.description: The original Lion Capital from the Ashoka Pillar at Sarnath, now the national emblem of India.
topExhibits.significance: National symbol and masterpiece of Mauryan art

topExhibits.name: Buddha Statues
topExhibits.description: Collection of Buddha statues from various periods, including the famous standing Buddha from Sarnath.

topExhibits.name: Buddhist Relics
topExhibits.description: Sacred relics and fragments from the ancient Sarnath stupa and monasteries.

topExhibits.name: Stupa Fragments
topExhibits.description: Carved stone fragments and panels from the ancient Sarnath stupa, depicting Buddhist scenes.

topExhibits.name: Inscriptions
topExhibits.description: Stone inscriptions in various scripts documenting the history of Sarnath and Buddhism.
